line: The twists and turns knock me out for a second. After waking up I find yourself laying on soft grass.
There's a beautiful garden around me, dimly illuminated by fireflies and lamp poles. The air is fresh and fragrant, and the hole I just fell out of is nowhere to be found.
There's also a two-floor mansion quite a bit away.
It seems like it's night, but I can neither see the moon nor any stars. Moreover, I can't actually see anything past the gates of the estate - it's enveloped in complete darkness.

speaker: I
line: (Reckon that exploring the estate will be a better idea than going out into the darkness, at least for now.)

speaker: I
line: (Still, this place definetly feels wrong. Much better than the cave though.)
